text: It steals everything from Blade Runner but does so poorly
Detective Android is the one who "becomes human"
Your choices have never been more meaningless and have no purpose in the story
Demons!!! Magic!!! Scary foreign culture!!! Aliens!!! Ghosts!!!
Two characters with no chemistry will fall in love because every film needs a romantic subplot with emoshuns
Incredible unsubtle allegories of real-life racism and oppression being applied to a bunch of high-tech toasters
The androids will be made from the souls of dead humans by the evil corporations who makes them
Funny glitches & unintentionally hilarious scenes and failstates
Sex scene that makes everyone uncomfortable
Cops are useless and that's not how the police operate
Humans are assholes who all hate the androids except for the noble homeless people and the kids
The evil corporation is evil and humans are obviously the real monsters
the villain is doing the bad thing for a very specific and sympathetic reason but does a 180 into being cartoonishly evil
The first red-herring will be a robot but the the villain will be an android who is disgused
Flashbacks and events happening out-of-order for no reason/because it's artistic or whatever
The game straight up lies to you about stuff that happened
Attempts to be meta and fails
No amount of extra people can stop the story and plot from being a complete mess
Heterochromia-bot will do the kung-fu and be the Ethan of the game
The robots will have robot drugs to keep them down, man
The game will be lavished with praise on release and then never be spoken of again a month later
Shitty NPC that shames a main character for doing anything or being different
Female lead falls in love with the hero
"Get out of jail" prompt asspull that invalidates your previous efforts
Time to play an unrelated activity that kills all the tension!
Cops are a nuisance to the hero and the story
Flashback that conveniently reveals key information
Confusing action turned into a QTE for no reason
Happy or hopeful moment hijacked by misery and sadness
Hero in front of a simple background and staring at your soul
Revelation that breaks the narrative consistency
Looooooooooooong QTE sequence of an action scene
Forced romance between main character and side character
Casual racism (bonus if there's a Chinese guy with racist accents)
No actual freedom to move around
Sad/tense scene too laughable to be sad/tense
Main character/villain suddenly gets new powers for no reason
Failing QTEs does not cause a game over (game overs are a failure of the game design)
Main character talking/thinking out lout at camera
"Strong independent woman" needs to be saved by a man
Characterization is a failure of the game designer
